Re: License #: CM231002162
Dear Mr. Brown:
Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. The
study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing statutes and
administrative rules. Therefore, an original license is issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Appletree Youth Therapeutic Respite Home is a ranch style home located in a
neighborhood in Lansing. Upon arriving at the home there is a driveway that leads
to a garage and a pathway to the front door. Upon entry into the home there is a
spacious foyer area, with an entryway to the right that leads to the kitchen and the
staff office straight forward. Off the kitchen is a dining room and hallway that leads
to three bedrooms and a bathroom. In the hallway is two doors, one that is locked
and stores all cleaning products, and the other door leads to the basement area
that is locked at all times and will not be an area youth access or use. Across from
the dining room is the living area for the youth which also has a second door to
the staff office, and a large sliding glass door that leads to the backyard where
there is a deck and fenced in yard for the youth to use. There is a hallway off the
living room that passes the foyer area and goes into an L-shape where there is
three additional bedrooms and a bathroom. At the end of the hallway is a quiet
room for youth to use to visit with workers, family, or hangout in. The staff
bathroom and closet are located in the quiet area and are locked at all times. The
medications are stored in a locked cart in the staff office which is to remain locked
with closed doors at all times.
2

An Environmental Health Inspection was approved on January 21, 2025, resulting
in an “A” rating. The Bureau of Fire Services completed and approved a plan
review for the facility and final inspection on January 21, 2025. The Delta
Township approved the house to be used in this capacity on October 25, 2024.
B. Program Description
Appletree Youth Therapeutic Respite Home is an open program designed to
provide a safe and structured environment for youth in need of respite. Appletree
Youth Therapeutic Respite Home is a short-term placement for youth in need of
respite care services. Appletree is an out of home placement that can last
anywhere from 2 – 48 Hours. The program can house 6 youths in the age range
of 5-17 years of age, both female and male. The minimum staff to youth ratio that
must be maintained at all times is two staff to six youth when the youth are awake
and one staff to six youth while sleeping.
Appletree Youth Therapeutic Respite Home strives to serve youth by providing a
structured environment to help the youth grow in their abilities to socialize, make
healthy decisions, and practice safe coping and de-stressing skills. While at
Appletree Youth Therapeutic Respite Home, the youth will follow a schedule that
helps them get on track with their schoolwork as well as having them participate in
activities of daily living, and emphasizes safe and healthy social interaction, as
well as safe and healthy self-care. A normal day starts at 7:00am and ends at
9pm with a range of activities, including attending their school, chores, free time,
etc. The schedule is adapted to the needs of the youth that are present so that
they can get the most benefit out of their time. Case Managers and
therapist/counselors may complete onsite visits while youth are placed at
Appletree Youth Therapeutic Respite Home. Appletree Youth Therapeutic Respite
Home will utilize Aegis for crisis prevention, de-escalation, and physical
intervention.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statues.
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on substantial compliance with the rules, it is recommended that a six-month
original license be issued.
